questions.Q: The equation of the circle 1 shown in the figure is:
questions.E: The equation of the circle of radius $$R$$ with center at $$(h,k)$$ is $$(x-h)+(y-k)=R^2$$. In this case $$(h,k)=(5,-5)$$ and $$R=4$$

questions.Q: The equation of the circle 2 shown in the figure is:
questions.E: The equation of the circle of radius $$R$$ with center at $$(h,k)$$ is $$(x-h)^2+(y-k)^2=R^2$$. In this case $$(h,k)=(-3,-3)$$ and $$R=3$$

questions.Q: The equation of the circle 3 shown in the figure is:
questions.E: The equation of the circle of radius $$R$$ with center at $$(h,k)$$ is $$(x-h)^2+(y-k)^2=R^2$$. In this case $$(h,k)=(2,3)$$ and $$R=1$$

questions.Q: The equation of the circle 4 shown in the figure is:
questions.E: The equation of the circle of radius $$R$$ with center at $$(h,k)$$ is $$(x-h)^2+(y-k)^2=R^2$$. In this case $$(h,k)=(7,8)$$ and $$R=2$$

questions.Q: The equation of the circle 5 shown in the figure is:
questions.E: The equation of the circle of radius $$R$$ with center at $$(h,k)$$ is $$(x-h)^2+(y-k)^2=R^2$$. In this case $$(h,k)=(-6,7)$$ and $$R=2$$
